FeedItems.Title: Whatâ€™s new in Azure SignalR 1.1.0 Preview 1
FeedItems.Summary: We just shipped 1.1.0 Preview 1 of Azure SignalR Service SDK to support some new features in ASP.NET Core 3.0, including endpoint routing and server-side Blazor. Let’s take a look how you...

FeedItems.Title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET Core 3.0 Preview 5
FeedItems.Summary:
ASP.NET Core updates in .NET Core 3.0 Preview 5
.NET Core 3.0 Preview 5 is now available. This iteration was brief for the team and primarily includes bug fixes and improvements to the more...

FeedItems.Title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET Core 3.0 Preview 4
FeedItems.Summary:
.NET Core 3.0 Preview 4 is now available and it includes a bunch of new updates to ASP.NET Core.
Here’s the list of what’s new in this preview:
Razor Components renamed back to server-side...

FeedItems.Title: Blazor now in official preview!
FeedItems.Summary: With this newest Blazor release we’re pleased to announce that Blazor is now in official preview! Blazor is no longer experimental and we are committing to ship it as a supported web UI...

FeedItems.Title: Updated Razor support in Visual Studio Code, now with Blazor support
FeedItems.Summary: Today we are pleased to announce improved Razor tooling support in Visual Studio Code with the latest C# extension. This latest release includes improved Razor diagnostics and support for tag helpers...

Issues.Title: Is there any multi-level js calls?
Issues.Body:
Sorry but I'm not sure if any was facing below problem.
I'm integrating here map js libs with Blazor, when I call a js function using JsRuntime, this js method calls another js function itself. But that seems impossible.
Please let me know is it possible at the moment. Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Is there any multi-level js calls?" (#1800)

Issues.Title: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AzureAD.UI not working with Blazor NET Core 3.0
Issues.Body: Creating a new Blazor app with .Net Core 3.0 server I'm unable to use Azure AD authentication because I can't successfully add the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AzureAD.UI package on the Client project.  Trying to add the preview version fails because of the netstandard version of the client. If I install the 2.2 version I get a build/link error: MSB3073.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AzureAD.UI not working with Blazor NET Core 3.0" (#1797)

Issues.Title: Every Blazor project - the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
Issues.Body:
Hi!
Yesterday everything was fine. Today, every new/fresh project created with Visual Studio 2019 Preview is broken and it's showing only `Loading...` in browser.
Error in Google Chrome ver. 72.0.3626.109
```
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
components.webassembly.js:1 Uncaught (in promise) SyntaxError: Unexpected end of JSON input
    at Object.<anonymous> (components.webassembly.js:1)
    at components.webassembly.js:1
    at Object.next (components.webassembly.js:1)
    at i (components.webassembly.js:1)
```
It doesn't matter if project is clear `Blazor` or `Blazor (ASP.NET Core hosted)`. I didn't change anything. I just create a project and hit run on `IIS Express` button on top of VS.
```
dotnet --version
3.0.100-preview-010184
```
Blazor ver. 0.8.0 
Latest ASP.NET Core Blazor Language Services 

`dotnet build` - no errors
`dotnet run` - same behavior as build in VS.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Every Blazor project - the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)" (#1790)

Issues.Title: We can disable issues for this repo and have a rest :)
Issues.Body:
People still open issues here so maybe better to disable issues and don't waste time for porting new issues from here to aspnetcore.

 What is point to keep opening issues available?

  https://help.github.com/articles/disabling-issues/


![untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40779557/52990912-4bd95e80-33d8-11e9-84d4-d43f85ea0694.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "We can disable issues for this repo and have a rest :)" (#1789)

Issues.Title: <NavLink class="nav-link"> without  href=""
Issues.Body:
If you use NavLink -Component without href in Selfmade-BlazorComponent, the Selfmade-BlazorComponent is no longer loaded and you only get the following message in the console from Browser

> Uncaught Error: No element is currently associated with component 7
>     at e.updateComponent (blazor.server.js:23)
>     at Object.t.renderBatch (blazor.server.js:16)
>     at e.<anonymous> (blazor.server.js:38)
>     at blazor.server.js:16
>     at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
>     at e.invokeClientMethod (blazor.server.js:16)
>     at e.processIncomingData (blazor.server.js:16)
>     at e.connection.onreceive (blazor.server.js:16)
>     at WebSocket.i.onmessage (blazor.server.js:16)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " <NavLink class="nav-link"> without  href=""" (#1788)

Issues.Title: How can I get scroll position in scroll view?
Issues.Body:
Hi

I am going to build a scroll view component without using JS interop.
The view and scroll bar is separated so I want to know the scroll position in the scroll bar.
How can I know the scroll position in onscroll event?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How can I get scroll position in scroll view?" (#1783)

Issues.Title: How to make child component to be rendered in parent component?
Issues.Body:
Both of the parent and child component use the same int array object.

If I change the array in the parent component, the child component has to be rendered again.

How can I do this?

I was tried to bind the object to child component, however it said that cannot bind array object.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to make child component to be rendered in parent component?" (#1782)
